summary.para: Identifies the type of file information that should retrieve or should set.

remarks.para: As noted in the preceding section, some file information classes are valid only for use with . Others are valid only for use with . Where neither function is mentioned, the information class is valid with both functions.

summary.para: Minimal information for the file should be retrieved or set. Used for file handles. See .
Extended information for the file should be retrieved. Used for file handles. Use only when calling . See .
The file name should be retrieved. Used for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
The file name should be changed. Used for file handles. Use only when calling . See .
The file should be deleted. Used for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
The file allocation information should be changed. Used for file handles. Use only when calling . See .
The end of the file should be set. Use only when calling . See .
File stream information for the specified file should be retrieved. Used for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
File compression information should be retrieved. Used for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
File attribute information should be retrieved. Used for any handles. Use only when calling . See .

Files in the specified directory should be retrieved. Used for directory handles. Use only when calling . The number of files returned for each call to GetFileInformationByHandleEx depends on the size of the buffer that is passed to the function. Any subsequent calls to GetFileInformationByHandleEx on the same handle will resume the enumeration operation after the last file is returned. See .
Identical to FileIdBothDirectoryInfo, but forces the enumeration operation to start again from the beginning. See .
Priority hint information should be set. Use only when calling . See .
File remote protocol information should be retrieved. Use for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
Files in the specified directory should be retrieved. Used for directory handles. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
Identical to FileFullDirectoryInfo, but forces the enumeration operation to start again from the beginning. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
File storage information should be retrieved. Use for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
File alignment information should be retrieved. Use for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
File information should be retrieved. Use for any handles. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
Files in the specified directory should be retrieved. Used for directory handles. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
Identical to FileIdExtdDirectoryInfo, but forces the enumeration operation to start again from the beginning. Use only when calling . See .
Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported before Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
This value is used for validation. Supported values are less than this value.
